NEW STRETCH GOALS UNLOCKED!
DIGITAL COMICS EXTRAVAGANZA UNLOCKED!
KIRA OKAMOTO PRINT UNLOCKED!
WINGED MONKEY SQUADRON STICKER UNLOCKED!
DEATH FROM ABOVE ENAMEL PINS UNLOCKED!
What if The Hurt Locker took place in The Wizard of Oz? Find out in The O.Z., a thrilling new comic series from Ringo Award-nominated writer David Pepose (Spencer & Locke, Going to the Chapel) and red-hot new artist Ruben Rojas that transforms a childhood classic into a war story for the ages. Debuting on Kickstarter with a 44-page first chapter, this campaign is dedicated to bringing this action-packed twist on L. Frank Baum’s iconic Oz novels to life. Fans of Mad Max, The Old Guard, and Fables will not want to miss out on The O.Z. 
FOLLOW THE YELLOW BRICK ROAD
Decades ago, when a young girl defeated the Wicked Witch of the West, she said farewell to the magical land of Oz… but unwittingly plunged the country in a vicious power vacuum leading to years of brutal civil war. But a generation later, the name of Dorothy Gale lives on in her granddaughter, an Iraq war veteran grappling with disillusionment and PTSD — yet when a tornado strikes Dorothy’s quiet Kansas town, this former soldier finds herself in the war-torn battlefield known only as The O.Z. Forced to navigate warring factions led by the Tin Soldier, the Scarecrow, and the Courageous Lion, Dorothy must come to terms with her legacy and her past if she ever hopes to bring peace to the Occupied Zone.
SNEAK PREVIEW
Reimagining the classic L. Frank Baum mythology of the Wizard of Oz through the lens of war, The O.Z. is a comic that takes no prisoners thanks to its striking artwork. With our first issue clocking in at 44 pages, we thought this preview would speak for itself: 
THE BOOK
Teaming up with rising star artist Ruben Rojas, Eisner-winning colorist Whitney Cogar (Giant Days, Steven Universe), and ace letterer DC Hopkins (Titans, Ghosted in L.A.), The O.Z. is an action-packed story of heart-rending choices, hard-fought redemption, and finding meaning amid the fog of war... even on the other side of the rainbow. 
For you process junkies out there, we'll be printing this book on a heavy 80 lb. glossy paper stock with a cover at 100 lb. glossy cover stock. And shipping? We'll be bagging and boarding every issue we send front and back — The O.Z. doesn't quit, and neither will our dedication to delivering readers our books as safely as possible.
VARIANTS
We also have a trifecta of limited edition variant covers from some fan-favorite artists, starting with our DEATH FROM ABOVE cover from the unstoppable Maan House (Godkillers, Spencer & Locke)!
And catch this incredible APOCALYPSE OZ variant from Rio Burton (Lucid Dreaming, Destiny, NY)!
Finally, don't miss out on our insane HIT-AND-RUN Akira homage variant cover from Kenneth Wagnon (Hearts Full of Sand)!
We will also have exclusive discount tiers for the retailer community, so you can get all four covers of The O.Z. in your customers' hands as soon as possible!
STRETCH GOALS
Thanks to your incredible support, we've blown past our original goals, and are unveiling the first of our stretch goals!
STRETCH GOAL #1 UNLOCKED — $25,000 — DIGITAL COMICS EXTRAVAGANZA! 
EVERY BACKER will receive a MASSIVE digital comics library featuring over a dozen red-hot creators, including Kevin Eastman (co-creator of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Drawing Blood), Justin Jordan (co-creator of The Strange Talent of Luther Strode, Spread), Rylend Grant (co-creator of Aberrant, Banjax, The Jump), Frank Gogol (co-creator of No Heroine, Dead End Kids), and MANY, MANY MORE. So keep spreading the word, because we've got a HUGE amount of rewards in store!
STRETCH GOAL #2 UNLOCKED — $30,000 — KIRA OKAMOTO PRINT!
ALL PHYSICAL BACKERS will receive our incredible comic-sized YELLOW BRICK ROAD WARRIOR print of The O.Z. by artist Kira Okamoto! 
STRETCH GOAL #3 UNLOCKED — $35,000 — WINGED MONKEY SQUADRON STICKER
Fly the unfriendly skies of The O.Z.! ALL PHYSICAL BACKERS will get our awesome Winged Monkey Squadron sticker!
STRETCH GOAL #4 UNLOCKED — $40,000 — DEATH FROM ABOVE ENAMEL PIN
ALL PHYSICAL BACKERS PLEDGING "ALL FOUR COVERS" OR ABOVE will receive this terrific enamel pin inspired by artist Maan House's "Death From Above" variant cover! We will also be offering the pin as a paid add-on in our BackerKit surveys for any other tiers, or if backers which to purchase additional pins.
STRETCH GOAL #5 — $45,000 — SECRET FIFTH COVER
This is it! We're in the last 24 hours, and we're pulling out the big guns — if The O.Z. crosses $45,000 before our Kickstarter wraps up, we will unveil an EXCLUSIVE SECRET FIFTH COVER as an add-on to our BackerKit page!
BACKER STRETCH GOALS
The O.Z. is only as strong as its Yellow Brick Road Warriors, so we're officially launching Backer Stretch Goals! If our campaign crosses 1,000 readers, writer David Pepose will record an exclusive behind-the-scenes commentary track for our 44-page first issue, which ALL BACKERS will receive!
SOCIAL STRETCH GOALS
We want to keep building our Emerald Army for The O.Z. — so we're launching new Social Stretch goals for our fans! For every 100 Retweets and 100 Likes this linked Twitter post receives, we'll unlock all-new content for our fans — starting with a specially recorded theme song for The O.Z.!
Keep liking, retweeting, and sharing to reveal a special Dorothy pin-up from artist Ruben Rojas!
ADD-ONS
Want to know what goes into making a comic like The O.Z.? We'll be offering behind-the-scenes materials including my scripts, as well as Ruben's inks and Whitney's colors! 
Don't miss The O.Z. artist Ruben Rojas' limited edition sketch card featuring Dorothy!
But wait, there's more! We also have commissions for original black-and-white head sketches from series artist Ruben Rojas! Check out Ruben's amazing #SixFanArts sketches for an example of his work:

 Not enough? For just a little bit more, you can even get yourself drawn into the book! 
Could you be an unlucky Munchkin who's about to get punched in the face? Or maybe a bystander to a Winged Monkey ambush? The possibilities are endless!
We also have one-on-one Skype sessions with me! As a Ringo Award-nominated writer as well as having worked as a DC Comics editorial intern and served for a decade as the Reviews Editor at Newsarama, I'll be happy to review your pitch, talk about comics writing, discuss how to navigate publicity or Hollywood... you get to set the agenda!
And if you haven't read my other work, you can also catch up during this campaign!  
What if Calvin and Hobbes grew up in Sin City? Backers of The O.Z. will also be able to catch up on my breakout series Spencer & Locke from me and Ringo Award-nominated artist Jorge Santiago, Jr., following hard-boiled Detective Locke as he investigates a brutal murder with the help of his seven-foot-tall imaginary panther Spencer.
Our psychological thriller was nominated for FIVE Mike Wieringo Comic Book Industry Awards ("Ringo Awards"), including BEST SERIES, BEST COVER ARTIST, BEST COLORIST, BEST LETTER, and BEST WRITER, alongside comic industry heavyweights including Tom King, Neil Gaiman, Jason Aaron, Jeff Lemire, and Matt Kindt!
Not only was Spencer & Locke first announced by The Hollywood Reporter, but our series was optioned for the big screen before our fourth issue even came out!
But don't just believe us — here's what our fans had to say about Spencer & Locke:
"Richly imagined and darkly original... a fantastic debut." - Scott Snyder (Batman)
"Stunningly subversive... a fiendishly fun take on an age-old classic." - IGN 
Additionally, we also have our hit sequel, the Barnes & Noble-ranked Spencer & Locke 2, which follows embattled Detective Locke and his imaginary friend Spencer, as they face their deadliest enemy yet — a scarred former soldier by the name of Roach Riley!
"A fever dream of nostalgia and noir... an original voice from one of comics' most unique writers." - Bryan Edward Hill (Detective Comics, Killmonger) 
"Riveting... you won't regret giving Spencer & Locke your time." - ComicBook.com
Finally, you can find out why love is the ultimate hostage situation in Going to the Chapel, from me and artist Gavin Guidry! Think Ocean's Eleven meets Arrested Development — at a wedding! — and you'll get the vibe of this super-fun book.
When a wealthy heiress gets cold feet on the day of her wedding, she couldn’t predict her big day would be hijacked by a gang of Elvis-themed bank robbers looking for a $250 million score. But the heist is blown and police surround the chapel, this conflicted bride becomes the ringleader of her own hostage situation to escape walking down the aisle!
Not only did Going to the Chapel score rave reviews across its release, but it even nabbed a surprise endorsement from actor and comedian Patton Oswalt:
And finally, we have our ultra-rare premium tiers! Who's this cool blue cat? He's no Cowardly Lion — this is Spencer, the imaginary stuffed blue panther from my breakout series Spencer & Locke!
We had a few Spencer dolls custom handmade to celebrate our book's release... but we happen to have a handful left over. When he's not solving crimes, Spencer is the best friend you could possibly imagine, so let's give this panther a loving home!
And last but not least, if you want to be the ultimate backer of The O.Z., you can bring me to any comic shop in the continental United States for an exclusive signing!
While I'm rubbing elbows with your friends, you can ask me anything you want about writing comics, working in publicity, or how to run a Kickstarter! (Note: This reward will require confirmation that your local comics shop is willing to host; please note that timing will be contingent on covid subsiding and any future convention scheduling.)
About The O.Z. Team
A former crime reporter turned comic book professional, David Pepose is the Ringo Award-nominated writer of Spencer & Locke, Spencer & Locke 2, Going to the Chapel, the upcoming Grand Theft Astro, and more. Beyond developing stories for comics, film and TV, David has also worked for CBS, Netflix, DC Comics, and Universal Studios. Follow him on Twitter at @peposed.
Born in Malaga, Ruben Rojas read his first comic book at the age of five, kicking off his dream to make his living drawing. He finished his Illustration degree in 2010 and won several art contests in his native Spain. His work has been published in Cthulhu Magazine, Rogues! for Amigo Comics, and Proton for Blackjack Press. Follow him on Twitter at @ruben__rojas.
Whitney Cogar is a comic colorist and illustrator from Savannah, GA. She contributed colors to the two-time Eisner Award-winning Giant Days (BOOM! Studios), the miniseries Wicked Things (BOOM! Studios), and Lucy Knisley's Peapod Farm series (Random House). Follow her on Twitter at @smashpansy.
DC Hopkins is a professional comic book letterer and designer who has worked with a wide variety of clients ranging from Eisner-nominated indie projects, to major publishers such as BOOM! Studios, DC Comics, IDW, Dark Horse, Image, Humanoids, Tor, Disney, Oni, and more. In addition to being a freelancer, DC is also a proud staff member of Deron Bennett's AndWorld Design studio. Follow him on Twitter at @dc_hopkins.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While this is our first Kickstarter, we're grateful to have several veteran Kickstarter creators guide our efforts for THE O.Z., including Charlie Stickney (White Ash, The Game), Rylend Grant (The Jump), Karla Nappi (Duplicant), Clay Adams (Deadskins, Red XMas), Steven Prince (Monster Matador), Dave Schrader (Baby Badass) and Frank Gogol (Grief).

Beyond drawing any backers’ likenesses into the book, the artwork, colors, lettering, and production for all 44 pages of THE O.Z. #1 is fully complete, and only needs to be sent to the printer and shipped to backers. Furthermore, I've already written the entire series, and Ruben, Whitney, and DC are already hard at work on Issue #2.

Despite the covid pandemic, our printer is considered an essential business, and in the off-chance there are delays with the postal service, we will ship your books via an alternative service. We are also investing in top-notch shipping supplies, and I will be handling all fulfillment personally. 

We are firm believers that our readers should never be taken for granted, so if you have any questions, don’t hesitate to reach out, and we will get you squared away.

campaign.story:
Ahoy!
Hello! Thank you for visiting our Kickstarter campaign. We’re incredibly excited to share this with our family, friends and tiki fans alike.
Recently, we’ve developed our budding Promistyx company brand together, which Mistyx Tiki falls under. We’re both big mythology nerds, and the Promistyx name represents a promise we’re making to ourselves to bring this product and this Kickstarter to life.
We have SO MANY great designs, so this campaign will also help in developing future designs and bringing this tiki to (virtual, and someday in-person) shows in the SoCal area.
Thanks for giving us this chance!
Aaron & Jenn
About the Product
Aaron has designed dozens of unique tiki and mug designs, but this one stood out as the one to launch with. The Death Blow mug establishes that we push the envelope on traditional tiki designs, and also pushes the boundaries of what a tiki mug can be. We both are Los Angeles transplants from the other side of the country. It’s more than apparent to us what makes LA unique, and we hope to be able to bring those SoCal-inspired designs to life following this campaign. But modern tiki culture is rooted in Los Angeles, and it’s that history that we’re evolving in our work.
Jenn fought hard for the “Death Blow” title of this mug, and desperately hopes it’s not a bad omen for this campaign - just a fun, apt name that collectors will enjoy.
 We first printed the mug at 5.5” high, which would have landed around 5.1” with typical ceramic shrinkage. The 3D print felt nice in a grip, but wouldn’t have confidently held a decent cocktail. So we decided to reprint at 6.75”, which resulted in a much more comfortable size! Final fired mug should be around 6.25" tall. We’re now in the molding phase of the project - and the outcome of this campaign will determine how many molds we make. We’ve partnered with LA-based Bauer Pottery, home of Tiki Bauer, and are excited to bring this concept to life with them.
To create the cannon base, we’ve decided to hand-cast and hand-paint each and every one. So no matter who you are, if you purchase one of our “Death Blow” or “Hell Fire” bases, you will have a one-of-a-kind piece! This is why we’re limiting the number of orders, but we’ll do our best to expand the offering as much as possible.
We were inspired by our paint prototyping to do a lava-themed variant of the glaze and base, which is where “Hell Fire” comes in. While “Death Blow” will be an open edition, “Hell Fire” will be strictly limited in its run.
In our initial outreach to friends and family about this product’s price point, we were told repeatedly that we’re underselling ourselves with this rate. (Thanks, guys! They like us. They really like us…) Coming out the gate, we want everyone to be able to afford this mug should they want it. We’re living through surreal times right now, and that gives us no right or reason to jack the price up for the “Hell Fire” of it.
What else ya got?
In addition to the mugs, we’re producing a new enamel pin designed by Aaron. Whereas Mystyx Tiki is our tiki product development line, “Miss Styx” are our pinup illustrations. This Miss Styx is a hula girl who stands behind the  #freethenipple movement and never steps foot on the beach without a Bahama Mama in her cup.
We also have some special stretch goals lined up that we’re hoping to reach during this campaign! The first is a set of swizzles and picks, specially designed for these mugs. 
Similar to the swizzle sticks, we’ve created cannon themed cocktail umbrellas. We want all your cocktails in these mugs to be explosive. (har har) 
 So.... who are we, again? 
Promistyx is a husband-wife team based out of Los Angeles featuring 2D digital art and enamel pins as well as the development of artisan drinkware and apparel prints.
Aaron is a longtime product developer in the toy and collectibles industry. He has a background in industrial design and over ten years of combined experience in art direction and product manufacturing. It’s a dream to finally bring one of his own designs to life!
When not helping run the business side of her husband Aaron's designs and product development, Jenn also produces one-of-a-kind functional ceramics pieces. Her art is heavily inspired by nature and autumnal themes.
Why $32,000?
While swizzle sticks and cocktail picks are individually not expensive, they come with very high minimum order quantities (MOQs) when it comes to manufacturing them. We've identified that $32K milestone as where we're comfortable ordering 10,000 (yep, that's the MOQ) of each. The good news there is that we'll be able to add *at least* a 4-pack of each to every cannon tiki mug ordered!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With ceramics, there's always the chance of breakage. We've integrated the cost of ordering enough to cover standard breakage rate, and have the ability to tailor the order to the final total.

We're also working with a local, US-based company to produce the ceramic mugs, so we're drastically reducing the risk of loss and time (compared to internationally based manufacturers.)

Expanding the world of the 2016 IDW/Comics Experience miniseries, GUTTER MAGIC: TALES FROM THE GUTTER #1 is a 30-page digital PDF with 3 all new Gutter Magic stories from series writer, Rich Douek, featuring the work of talented artists like RENAE DE LIZ (LEGEND OF WONDER WOMAN, PETER PAN), BRETT BARKLEY (GUTTER MAGIC) and ERYK DONOVAN (QUANTUM TEENS ARE GO, MEMETIC). In addition, we're proud to feature some up-and coming talent, with 2 back-up stories written and drawn by members of the COMICS EXPERIENCE Creator's Workshop!
In the 2016 series, Gutter Magic explored the story of a man named Cinder Byrnes, in his quest to become a wizard. Born without powers to one of the most prestigious wizarding families in the city, he was determined to gain the powers of magic for himself, and turned half the city upside down to do it.
Didn't get a chance to read it? Check out the first 7 pages right here!
But that's just one story in a city full of them. In a world where wizards, goblins, fairies, and regular folks mingle together in a fantastical version of New York City, there's plenty of tales to be told.
TALES FROM THE GUTTER explores some of these stories, and see the world of Gutter Magic through new perspectives.
In DEAD AND BURIED, we'll learn more about what drives Shiver - daughter of the Morgue, and leader of the Ghost Knives street gang. Featuring the wonderful art of Renae De Liz and Ray Dillon.
Pencils by Renae De Liz, Inks by Ray Dillon
In FREE SPIRITS, Eryk Donovan will illustrate the world through the eyes of the various elementals and spirits that the wizards employ. Turns out that most of them don't appreciate being bound. 
Free Spirits Character Sketch by Erica Rose Levine
And, in  DIRTY WORK, Brett Barkley shows us the scavengers, who salvage weapons and technology from the great war, from the dangerous lands that lie beyond the city's borders.
Character Design by Brett Barkley
PLUS, We've got new pinup art from talented creators that are so hot, they're guaranteed to blister your eyeballs! Here's just a small sampling of the pieces we'll be revealing over the course of the campaign:
Whispers, by Doug Hills
  Shiver, by Bree Jordan
  Oppenheimer, by Stan Chou
Here's a NEW pinup by artist Kelly Williams! Kelly has been aweseome enough to offer the ORIGINAL artwork as a reward - check out the TREEBEARD tier for details! 
Cosmic Cinder by Kelly Williams
NEW REWARD! 

Artist Matt Horak (PUNISHER, THE COVENANT) has created a set of 5 Gutter Magic-themed sketch cards! Backers will get these as part of the Pinup PDF, but we're also thrilled to offer the original pieces for sale - just select the HORAK reward level to the right to snag them!
Sketch Cards by Matt Horak
Here's another new art reward, featuring Shiver and Cinder, by the amazing Zach Bassett!
Shiver Reflection by Zach Bassett
There's only one physical set of these available, so if you love Matt's art, and lets face it, how could you not, get on it! 
If you haven't had a chance to check out the miniseries, have a look at what some of the hottest talents working today have to say about it:
“Gutter Magic is smart fantasy that’s well worth your time and treasure.”
- Charles Soule
(DAREDEVIL, DARTH VADER, DEATH OF WOLVERINE)
"Gutter Magic is a fantasy-fueled caper that mixes gun-slinging and spell-slinging. Fun stuff!"
- Jim Zub
(WAYWARD, UNCANNY AVENGERS)
“ Weird and surprising, which is what this and are two of my favorite things in comics. And fun, which is the part that really matters. There’s not a lot of urban fantasy steampunk in comics, and Gutter Magic makes a good argument that we’ve been missing out.”
- Justin Jordan (SPREAD, LUTHER STRODE)
“GUTTER MAGIC is a smart, engaging, and original debut that cements Douek & Barkley as creators to watch. With great characters, wonderfully composed action scenes, and an effortless sense of world building, GUTTER MAGIC pulled me in from the first page and has me anxiously waiting for issue two!”
-Frank Barbiere  
(FIVE GHOSTS, VIOLENT LOVE)
“Douek and Barley’s GUTTER MAGIC is a surreal and densely illustrated piece of work with charming characters that pull you into the story. And magic.”
- Declan Shalvey
(INJECTION, MOON KNIGHT)
PARTNERSHIP WITH COMICS EXPERIENCE

A long time ago, the world's most renowned superhero disappeared and justice was handed over to the grim-n-gritty vigilantes that blurred the line between the righteous and the wicked. Everyone forgot what it truly meant to be a hero... until the day the Giant Robot Octopus Alien Monster attacked! When one little boy finds the courage to stand up to this alien invader, it just might be enough to inspire the return of the world's greatest superhero... 
Captain Ultimate is an all-ages superhero series created by Joey Esposito, Ben Bailey, and Boy Akkerman that is published digitally by Monkeybrain Comics. Though it’s been well-received, the nature of the direct market has made it difficult for Captain Ultimate to find a home in print. 
That’s why we’re turning to Kickstarter to fund the print collection of Captain Ultimate #1-6! This will include the printing and shipping costs and getting it distributed via Diamond so kids all over the world can order the book efficiently from their local comic book shop, library, or book store.
The issues are fully completed (and can be read on Comixology), so the book will be off to the printer as soon as funding is reached. You’ll be able to read all of the crazy adventures including (but not limited to) the sentient ninja alphabet, the buffest Santa Claus you’ve ever seen, punk rock Halloween, carnival carnage, and a Giant Robot Octopus Alien Monster rethinking his life choices! 
Want to make sure that what you're backing is awesome? Read Captain Ultimate #1 for free by clicking on the image below: 
  We believe that all-ages comics are undervalued in the market, but we’ve experienced first-hand how important they can be. Here’s a letter we received and printed back in Captain Ultimate #3: 
This hit us hard when it came in because it was validation of everything we believed, and has been a reminder for us during the journey of bringing Cap to print that it’s a worthwhile effort. It wasn’t a brand that attracted this kid, it was the story itself.
A story with a character he’d never seen or heard of before. A story he wouldn’t have ever seen without the help of Monkeybrain and the digital platform. There’s no reason the same thing couldn’t happen to a kid that comes across the book at his school library or local comic shop.
Of course we’re biased and confident about the book we put out, but there are lots of other great all-ages books out there that are in a similar spot. 
We know that it’s hard, as a parent, to go into your comic shop on Wednesdays with your kid and turn them away from Batman comics that are too violent for them or Spider-Man books that are too mature. There are the licensed options too, but as Logan has shown us, sometimes that’s not enough. 
So here's what we're offering to help us get Captain Ultimate into the hands of kids everywhere:
If all of that stuff isn't quite enough, here are some kids, parents, and other readers enjoying their time with Team Ultimate:
      We hope you'll fall in love with these characters as much as we have. Thanks so much for your support -- of Captain Ultimate AND all-ages comics in general! The future of comics is our kids!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Having fulfilled two successful Kickstarters already, and consulted on several more, I'm well aware of the many challenges associated with delivering on a Kickstarter campaign. I’ve taken the following steps to mitigate the risk associated fulfilling this project:

1) The book is complete and ready to go to print right now. This means digital rewards can go out immediately after the campaign ends, and we can begin the printing process as soon as funding is secured. 

2) Our printer is reliable! We’re working with Trivision, a well-respected print shop that does books for Image, IDW, Th3rdWorld Studios and more. To date, ComixTribe has printed more than 17,500 copies of comic books with Trivision, and they’ve never let us down.

Feel free to review my previous Kickstarters (OXYMORON and EPIC) for evidence of my ability to communicate with backers post campaign, and deliver on campaign fulfillment.

Thank you for making the SCAM Ultimate Collection Happen. Keep tabs with SCAM and all things ComixTribe at ComixTribe.com.
STRETCH GOAL #2 - $28,000 - All Backers Names Printed on a Thank You Page in the Book!
“It’s better to die a conman, than live like a mark!”SCAM is an “X-Men meets Ocean's Eleven″-style series that follows a team of super-powered grifters on the biggest con of their lives...taking down a Vegas casino and getting revenge on a former teammate who double-crossed them. 
For the first time ever, I'm collecting the entire sold-out ComixTribe mini-series into a deluxe over-sized hardcover collection, also featuring the never-before-released SCAMthology - 15 brand new SCAM stories by a handpicked crew of outstanding comic creators!
With the help of Kickstarter and backers like you, I'll be able to create the definitive SCAM collection, and produce a 256-page, full-cover, over-sized hardcover collecting the 144 page SCAM mini-series, and the all new 100+ page SCAMthology, featuring 15 amazing super-powered heist stories by some of my favorite writers and artists.
The SCAM Mini-series
SCAM #1 first made waves in January 2012, when its first print run of just 777 copies, made available in only 21 comic book stores, sold-out. This initial DIY success helped ComixTribe achieve a Diamond distribution deal, letting us roll out the SCAM series to hundreds of other retailers around the world. Between August 2012 and December 2013, the rest of the SCAM mini-series was released in serial format, selling out at the distributor level.
Now, for the first time ever, we're collecting the entire series into a deluxe, over-sized hardcover collection.
STRETCH GOAL #1 - $26,500 - SPOT UV Cover Treatment - UNLOCKED!
Want a Taste of SCAM?
Read the first 22 pages of SCAM right here, right now!
The SCAMthology
In the pages of SCAM, I wanted to create a vast universe of colorful cons and crooks, with limitless storytelling potential. While I packed as much action and intrigue into the SCAM mini-series as possible, I wanted to load even more into this Ultimate Collection.
So, I put together the right crew for the job, and assembled some of the most talented writers and artists making waves in creator-owned comics today, and asked them to play in the SCAM sandbox.
15 Tales of Superpowered Heists and Hijinx
When extreme paranoia brings Hack to the office of Dr. Goodfellow, psychiatrist to the rich and powerful, issues get resolved that have little to do with his psychosis.
"The Nut Job" written by Tyler James (The Red Ten, EPIC), art by Will Robson (Unit 5), breakdowns by Jonathan Rector (The Standard), color by Dessi Cakra.
Hell hath no fury like Michelle scorned! Left for dead at the scene of a bank robbery, Michelle is determined to get her hands on the man responsible: her loving boyfriend!
"Guy Trouble" written by Rich Douek (Gutter Magic), art by Joe Eisma (Morning Glories), color by Hugo Froes.
The rest of the crew would never guess what their resident party animal, Pint, does with his free time. Sometimes the scammer is actually scamming himself.
"My Name is Pint" written by Josh Flanagan (The Remote, Boston), art by Doug Hills (Dixon's Notch), color by Hugo Froes.
Midas’ intended bank robbery goes wrong when masked gunmen attack first. Now it’s just a matter of survival.
"Withdrawal Symptoms" written by Jamie Gambell (Department O, The Hero Code), art by Daniel Picciotto, color by Miguel Marques.
After a con goes awry, the crew seek solace at a local bar, but Pint isn’t one to let a bad day ruin his entertainment!
"The Rounds" written by Steve Colle, art by Kirk Manley (Z-Girl and the 4 Tigers), color by Miguel Marques.
Pint has a very unique gift: the more alcohol he drinks, the stronger, faster and more durable he gets. But when he's given a near-impossible mission, just how much booze is he willing to chug to get the job done? And just how much of it will he remember in the morning?
"Hammered" written by John Lees (The Standard, And Then Emily Was Gone), art by Alex Cormack (Cuddlers, Oxymoron).
Tru awakens in a warehouse to a blinding spotlight shining in his face. Who is his captor and what is his deadly agenda? Now’s not the time for psychology; it’s time to get physical.
"The Machine" written by Ben McCool (Pigs, Choker), art by Alex Diotto (Southern Dog), color by Ty Tyner.
The Vegas skyline changes constantly as casino owners cut their current losing properties in order to attempt new venues and ventures. In the midst of a former Strip icon closing, Tru considers starting something new himself.
"The Fall of the Cherry Blossom" written by Nolan T. Jones (Colonial Souls), art by Joe Mulvey (SCAM).
Every memory is a lie, and everyone is a liar. Doc knows this best of all.
"The Big Lie" written by Paul Allor (Strange Nation, TMNT, GI Joe), art by Aaron Houston (Clockwork, Oxymoron), color by Ryan Lee.
Midas’ annual thefts at the JA New York Winter Show aren’t about the money as much as they are about the guilt he has towards his mamma.
"Guilt" written by Steve Forbes (Runners), art by Daniel J Logan (GhostTown, EXO-1), color by Vasco Sobral.
Three of Chiyoko Hashimoto’s briefcases are stolen by the crew and she’ll do anything to get them back, including running three high speed, high flying chases through the streets of Las Vegas. But are the contents of the cases what the con men are really after?
"Three Car Monte" written by Ryan K Lindsay (Fatherhood, Ghost Town), art by Adam Masterman (Echo Callaway), color by Vasco Sobral.
Michelle is conned by her own crewmates into stealing the jewels from a fetishist senator. Diamonds, that is.
"Let's Get This Party Started" written by Amy Chu (Girls Night Out), art by Brian Shearer (GI Joe, William the Last), color by Arsia Rozegar.
Mike the Bartender spins a classic fairy tale in a way you ain't never seen before!
"A SCAM Fairy Tale" written by Amy Chu, art by CP Wilson, III (The Stuff of Legend, Wraith), Joe Mulvey (SCAM), color by Ryan Lee.
 Hack is on a new anxiety medication, the side-effects of which put a heist in jeopardy.
"Ghost Shit" written by Joe Mulvey (SCAM), art by Nick Pitarra (Manhattan Projects).
The heist is over...what happens next will blow you away.
"Epilogue" written by Jason Ciaramella (The Cape), art by Joe Mulvey (SCAM), color by Ryan Lee.

Why Kickstarter?
We want to make a premium over-sized hardcover for collectors and fans who appreciate a well made book. Kickstarter has emerged as the single best platform for creators and small publishers like ComixTribe to fund the creation of premium graphic novels.
While we love our retail and distribution partners, ComixTribe sales through those channels alone are nowhere near large enough to support the creation of this kind of book. But with the support of backers like you here on Kickstarter, we can and will make it happen.
Plus, we look at the Kickstarter campaign as a month long online party. I've spent nearly every day the last three years working on SCAM, and now that it's done, I'm ready to have some fun. I hope you join me!
How Will the Kickstarter Funds Be Used?
All Kickstarter funds will be used to pay for the printing and fulfillment of the books and other rewards, and to help off-set the costs of creating this 256-page monstrosity. Should we raise more than the target goal, we'll look at making the book and the campaign even better.

campaign.story:
In 1976 …a secret war raged on Pluto.
In 2006…Pluto’s planet status was revoked.
One by one…those who know the truth are being silenced
But one man remembers everything.
30 years later… Cale Beckett must return to the...
Forgotten Planet is a 4 issue Science Fiction limited series , created by Pete Rogers and Giancarlo Caracuzzo. It follows Cale Beckett, a legendary former mercenary, as he seeks to unravel his past on the frozen planeoid.
You may remember that we ran a previous campaign for the complete Graphic Novel and raised over £4000 which was not quite enough to produce the full book. 
However we don't want to leave all of our supporters without the chance to enjoy this great story and so this campaign is designed to kickstart the series and fund the first issue. 
For this we need a much lower amount so you can still be part of this adventure and help make it all happen.
Issue #1 cover art by Giancarlo
 Meet The Creators
Pete Rogers
 Pete is an award-winning British writer, who came to comics via a series of screenwriting courses at Raindance in London. In 2007 he co-founded Orang Utan Comics, publishing anthology title Eleventh Hour, featuring his own short stories, alongside the work of other rising talent. Within a year the book had been nominated for an Eagle award. In 2011 his first graphic novel The Interactives was released, to critical acclaim, with art by Luciano Vecchio (Beware the Batman). Earlier this year the first title from his new imprint Dapper Chimp Press was released, ‘Chris Smith and the Nazi Zombies from Hell’ which he served as editor on.
"With his ferocious instinct for shifting perspectives, and a sniper’s eye for finding that which is relevant amidst that which is fantastical, Rogers’s recent work confirms his place as a leading light in the next wave of British comics talent. I’ll be looking forward to Forgotten Planet with huge anticipation." - SI SPURRIER
Giancarlo Caracuzzo
 Giancarlo has worked for most of the major European and American comics publishers, since his first work was published in 1982 in his native Italy. His bold, energetic artwork has been seen in the likes of Jonah Hex, Gorilla Man, Iron Man, Spider-Man and Random Acts of Violence. His work gives this project a unique style and voice, and we are very proud to have such a respected professional on board.
"Giancarlo is one of those classic talents largely lost to this modern world, building new worlds fully realized with weight and depth as if they'd always existed." -  IVAN BRANDON
“Giancarlo is a master storyteller and one of the freshest talents coming out of Europe at the moment. There is a reason I have worked with him over and over.” -  JIMMY PALMIOTTI
In addition to the main creative team artwork is also being provided by star guest creators Mike Collins, Chris Wildgoose and Azim Akberali. There work will feature both in the comics and on some of our reward items.
Here's the stunning artwork for the Pin Up by Chris Wildgoose:
A massive thanks to Chris for creating this great Poster for our book
A Little About Our Story
On Pluto Cale Beckett is infamous. He’s the poster boy used to instil fear into the Plutonian race. But Cale Beckett is living in denial. Beckett spends a solitary existence on a Tanzanian game reserve, with just his dog for company. He can remember the things he did on Pluto in the 70s and he’s been trying to forget about it ever since.
Cale Beckett by Azim Akberali
 When Pluto is downgraded to a planetoid, its new classification 134340 appears all over the media. This reignites the wiped memories of all the mercenaries who used to police the planet, and they are killed before they can talk. But Cale is different, he never forgot what happened, and killing him won’t be so easy. When mercenaries are sent to kill him, on the same day that Pluto’s planet status is revoked, he knows something is wrong. And he knows his two oldest friends are dead. The only way to unearth the truth, means a trip back into his past and a return to Pluto, the Forgotten Planet.
Sample page of Art from Giancarlo
"Forgotten Planet is definitely a labour of love for me, it’s a story I’ve been working on for some time and something I’ve completely thrown myself into. When the original artist, and my regular collaborator, Azim Akberali had health problems and wasn't able to continue with the book I shelved it for years. He was so keen for me to still push forward with the project that I eventually relented. Having the opportunity to see the world Cale Beckett inhabits come to life, courtesy of another world class artist like Giancarlo, is a dream come true.” PETE ROGERS 
 How will my money be spent? 
 We are offering you some fantastic exclusive rewards to raise £3,500 that will help to make this book happen. £70 a page will be paid to Giancarlo as an advance to allow him to work on the book. Giancarlo is giving this project the dedication of a true professional and for that we salute him! The rest of the funds will go towards the production of the issue and delivery of your rewards. Other publishing costs are being covered by British Indy Publishers Scar Comics. 
More great interiors from Giancarlo
 Bonus Extras: If we manage to go over our target we're planning to add some extra bonus features for our supporters. We'll unveil more about these as the campaign progresses.

campaign.story:
In 1976 …a secret war raged on Pluto.
In 2006…Pluto’s planet status was revoked. 
One by one…those who know the truth are being silenced.  
But one man remembers everything. 
30 years later… Cale Beckett must return to the… 
Forgotten Planet is a Science Fiction graphic novel, created by Pete Rogers and Giancarlo Caracuzzo.  It follows Cale Beckett, a legendary former mercenary, as he seeks to unravel his past on the frozen planetoid.  Read the first 5 pages here. 
Dust Jacket cover and canvas print
The Regular Edition of the book
Meet the Creators
Pete Rogers
Pete is an award-winning British writer, who came to comics via a series of screenwriting courses at Raindance in London. In 2007 he co-founded Orang Utan Comics, publishing anthology title Eleventh Hour, featuring his own short stories, alongside the work of other rising talent. Within a year the book had been nominated for an Eagle award. In 2011 his first graphic novel The Interactives was released, to critical acclaim, with art by Luciano Vecchio (Beware the Batman). Earlier this year the first title from his new imprint Dapper Chimp Press was released, ‘Chris Smith and the Nazi Zombies from Hell’ which he served as editor on.
"With his ferocious instinct for shifting perspectives, and a sniper’s eye for finding that which is relevant amidst that which is fantastical, Rogers’s recent work confirms his place as a leading light in the next wave of British comics talent. I’ll be looking forward to Forgotten Planet with huge anticipation." - SI SPURRIER
"A fun science fiction premise, a killer mystery and a hugely talented creative team behind it all. The Forgotten Planet looks like a winner. And In Pete Rogers it has a writer who, one feels, could well be a name to watch in the coming years." - ROB WILLIAMS
Giancarlo Caracuzzo 
Giancarlo has worked for most of the major European and American comics publishers, since his first work was published in 1982 in his native Italy. His bold, energetic artwork has been seen in the likes of Jonah Hex, Gorilla Man, Iron Man, Spider-Man and Random Acts of Violence. His work gives this project a unique style and voice, and we are very proud to have such a respected professional on board.
"Giancarlo is one of those classic talents largely lost to this modern world, building new worlds fully realized with weight and depth as if they'd always existed." -  IVAN BRANDON
“Giancarlo is a master storyteller and one of the freshest talents coming out of Europe at the moment. There is a reason I have worked with him over and over.” -  JIMMY PALMIOTTI
  "Having worked with Giancarlo on multiple projects including a successful kickstarter, I not only admire the quality of his illustrations, storytelling and professionalism, but also his dedication to seeing a a project through to the end. Plus he's a great guy." - JUSTIN GRAY
"Giancarlo was a pleasure to work with on Marvel's Gorilla Man. In that series he was tasked with delivering monkeys holding big guns, beautiful femme fatales, insane tech, multiple time eras, and elaborate action set pieces. He delivered with uncompromising dedication and flair . Giancarlo's a dynamic storyteller who puts characterization and atmosphere before anything else. His urgent line work is stylish and satisfying. He really can draw just about anything, and he makes it look easy too." - MICHAEL HORWITZ 
This is a full colour 100 page Graphic Novel edited by Shane Chebsey, who is running this campaign and many of the the special rewards attached to this edition will be exclusively available to Kickstarter Supporters only.
A little about our story
On Pluto Cale Beckett is infamous.
He’s the poster boy used to instil fear into the Plutonian race.
But Cale Beckett is living in denial. 
 Beckett spends a solitary existence on a Tanzanian game reserve, with just his dog for company. He can remember the things he did on Pluto in the 70s and he’s been trying to forget about it ever since. When Pluto is downgraded to a planetoid, its new classification 134340 appears all over the media.
This reignites the wiped memories of all the mercenaries who used to police the planet, and they are killed before they can talk. But Cale is different, he never forgot what happened, and killing him won’t be so easy. When mercenaries are sent to kill him, on the same day that Pluto’s planet status is revoked, he knows something is wrong. And he knows his two oldest friends are dead. The only way to unearth the truth, means a trip back into his past and a return to Pluto, the Forgotten Planet.
"Forgotten Planet is definitely a labour of love for me, it’s a story I’ve been working on for some time and something I’ve completely thrown myself into. When the original artist, and my regular collaborator, Azim Akberali had health problems and wasn't able to continue with the book I shelved it for years.  He was so keen for me to still push forward with the project that I eventually relented. Having the opportunity to see the world Cale Beckett inhabits come to life, courtesy of another world class artist like Giancarlo, is a dream come true.” PETE ROGERS
How will my money be spent?
We are offering you some fantastic exclusive rewards to raise £11,500 that will help to make this book happen.
 £7000 will be paid to Giancarlo as an advance to allow him to work on the book. This works out at a tiny page rate and well below industry standards. Despite this Giancarlo is giving this project the dedication of a true professional and for that we salute him!
The rest of the funds will go towards the production of the book and delivery of your rewards.
Other publishing costs are being covered by British Indy Publishers Scar Comics.
Bonus Extras:
If we manage to go over our target we're planning to add some extra bonus features for our supporters, including a star-studded launch party. We'll unveil more about as the campaign progresses.

Regardless if our funding goal is met, everybody who pledges is getting 44 pages of comics digitally! The 12-page Dry Seasons New York Comic Con comic with two short stories, sketches, pencils; and Space Corps #0, 32-pages of anthology that I had a story in, lettered half of, and story edit. 44 pages of comics!
What's the story?
Dry Seasons is Romeo & Juliet meets Mad Max.
Years after the apocalypse, Ann and Paul are two star-crossed lovers. They uncover a plot that could destroy their families, and other survivors.
"It’s a book I want to read, partly due to my weird fetish for all things Dust Bowl, but also because this post-apocalypse yarn has a romantic flair I think you’ll agree is quite compelling." - Paul Montgomery, iFanboy
"With a tagline like “Romeo and Juliet meets Mad Max” it’s hard not to be interested in Dry Seasons. It takes some familiar, but not related concepts, and thrusts them together. Dry Seasons is planned to be a four issue miniseries, that while completely telling its story, would still leave room for possible later volumes. Could it be amazing?"  - Leo Johnson, Geek Syndicate
"The perk and pricing for them is very reasonable so check it out and see what you think." - Dustin Cabeal, Comic Bastards
Dry Seasons is also featured in Comic Book Resources Kickstand column, on Vodka O'Clock, and on Fortune Geek Heroes.
Dry Seasons is an action-adventure story, lo-fi sci-fi comic book mini series. The four print and digital issues of Dry Seasons will be a complete "done-in-one" that has possibilities for future volumes.
We're doing full-color pages, each issue'll be 22 pages of original story and art. You can get signed editions, t-shirts, digital copies, behind-the-scenes info... there're lots of ways to check out Dry Seasons.
Here's more of the story, and check out some pages below:
Ann’s family runs the town of New Joad, controlling the fertile soil.  Ann is the dutiful daughter, suffering in silence for “what’s best for the family.” In the shadow of her older brother and sister, Ann plods along, numb to life.
Paul’s family leads the town of Potes, and its usable water. Paul is the middle kid, sandwiched between two superstar siblings. He thinks the dirt farmers should choke on their dust. Give Paul a day on a boat and he forgets all about the land.
Both sides need each other to live, but decades of hate and mistrust make it almost impossible. 
Then one day New Joad is attacked by raiders. In an effort to ensure their mutual survival, the two families meet. That’s when Ann and Paul fall in love.

What's in it for me?
The comic won't happen without YOU, Dry Seasons is entirely funded out-of-pocket. Thanks for checking out the rewards.  Here're some of the rewards offered:
Everything above a $10 pledge gets you the digital edition of Dry Seasons (and unlimited virtual high fives).
The next level up is all four issues of Dry Seasons in print!
We've got t-shirts
Note: not final t-shirt design
There's original art page and covers by series artist Ryan Cody
And other rewards like naming a character in the comic, signed copies of the print comics, and more. There's even a pledge to have a video (for a Kickstarter, for a business, for whatever makes sense) produced for you by an award-winning creative video and design firm. And everyone who pledges will get a copy of the ongoing Webcomic Space Corps #0 issue, which has an 8-page story written by me, illustrated by Gannon Beck.
Do you have reward suggestions? Feel free to let us know.
Where's the money going?
That's a good question, all the money will go into producing the comics and rewards. Here's how your pledge dollars help make Dry Seasons:
production costs
printing issues 1-4 of Dry Seasons
t-shirt production
shipping and handling of the print comics, art, and t-shirts
all those virtual high-fives
What if the goal is exceeded? Stretch goals!
I like your moxie. If we exceed the goal, we'll be able to put extra funds towards bonuses like more original art rewards, postcards, digital stand-alone stories, covering all the production costs for Dry Seasons, and expanding to more issues.
Yeah, what if you get like "Order of the Stick" exceeding?
Alright, you're hired into the Dry Seasons marketing department, that's some gumption. If we exceed the goal amount by "a whole bunch" we'll do some fun things like "making of" videos, offer up more original art, get some variant covers, produce a stand-alone issue with some guest creators, and do a live-action Web short.
That's right, live-action Web short. You said "Order of the Stick." I produced a documentary on professional bearding, I'm not playing around here (I'm totally playing around, it's a documentary about a facial hair competition).
Who is Making Dry Seasons?
Writing - Joey Groah is an award-winning writer/director/producer creating content for a variety of national and international clients including The Travel Channel, Discovery Communications, Comcast, and more. He's produced hours of video including original documentaries like Beardo the Movie. Joey also currently story edits the Webcomic Space Corps, as well as writing Space Corps short stories.
Art - Ryan Cody is a comic book artist, freelance illustrator & writer. He has previously illustrated the critically acclaimed graphic novel VILLAINS for Viper Comics. Ryan also contributed original covers for The Hero Initiative’s Ultimate Spider-Man #100 and Hulk #1 projects, helping to raise tens of thousands of dollars for comic book creators with medical and financial needs. Other clients include Image Comics, Maverik Films and Pearson Digital Education.
Editing - Paul Allor is the writer of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Fugitoid, Orc Girl and Clockwork, Volume One. His editing credits include Rex, Zombie Killer, Deluge and Girls Night Out. You can follow him on Twitter at @PaulAllor.
The Apocalypse? Again?
Well yeah, but this time it's all "farm machinery" and Steinbeck. The parts of Steinbeck you liked.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've been working on Dry Seasons for over two years. I joined a comics creating community called the Comics Experience Workshop so I could meet and learn from other people at various stages in their comics careers. My work has been critiqued by writers like Mike Raicht (writer The Stuff of Legend, Dark Shadows, former Marvel Comics editor), I've gotten to interact with comic creators from all walks of life including the Big Two, smaller publishers like Image, IDW, and Archaia and more. Writers, artists, editors, colorists, lawyers, marketers have all come through the Comics Experience Workshop and I've gotten to learn, ask questions, and build relationships with the comics community.

As a creator-owned comic, the costs for art, lettering, editing, printing, and distribution of Dry Seasons falls on me. With crowd sourced projects, I've always thought of pledging as "pre-ordering." I pre-order comics, I pre-order TV seasons, I pre-order live standup and concert tickets.

I've talked with some comic book publishers, and it's a tough time for most companies. While I don't have a firm commitment, I've had conversations with American publishers offering national and international distribution. Regardless of WHO publishes Dry Seasons, me solo working with Ryan and Paul or us partnering with an established publisher, we still have to deliver a finished comic to be published.

I'd like to deliver that comic to you sooner rather than later with or without a publisher. If we do get a publisher, this version of issues 1-4 will be the limited first edition of the mini series, and you will have made that happen. It'll be a couple months, like you pre-order comics, books, or tickets.

Thank you for your support of Dry Seasons!

Stories in this 36 page full color, digest size (5" x 8") issue include:
Something in the Air
artwork by Sean Chen
A Ph.D. student at Columbia University accidently triggers a pandemic with her research. With artwork by the fantastic Sean Chen who made is mark with Marvel's Iron Man, Valiant Comics' X-O Manowar.
Girls Night Out: All The Single Ladies 
pencils by Craig Yeung, colors by Juri H C
It's Christmas, and nursing home aide Jackie wants to do something special for one of her patients. Artwork by Craig Yeung, known for his work on Marvel's Runaways, and much more.
Corporate Bob Meets Sandy
artwork by Louie Chin
The saga of white collar CEO Bob as he explores the online world of his gamer son. But then superstorm Sandy wreaks havoc on his plans. Artwork by indie fav and New York native Louie Chin.
A Meta Kind of Day
A humorous modern twist on Kafka's Metamorphosis when a NYC teenager turns into a roach with unexpected results. Artwork by Brian Shearer (IDW Doctor Who, Transformers, and more)
Saving Abby: Rats, Foiled Again.
artwork by Cabbral
The futuristic action adventure of a tough New York cabbie named D. as she rescues a hostage from the slums known as... Manhattan. Cabbral was shortlisted for the Eagle award for Best New Talent earlier this year.
Serving Up Wall Street 
artwork by Gannon Beck

The 42 Small-Press Commandos that contributed to FUBAR: American History Z need your help getting this anthology to the printer! 
Hi! My name is Jeff McComsey and I'm the Editor in Chief of the Zombie anthology FUBAR.
The previous Two anthologies FUBAR: European THeater of the Damned and FUBAR: Empire of the Rising dead covered both theaters of World War 2. After the success of those first two volumes I'm beyond proud to announce our third and most ambitious volume:
FUBAR: American History Z.
The 32 stories that comprise FUBAR: American History Z Span the entire American experience from the discovery of the new world to the present day.
So replace zombie Nazis and zombie Kamikazes with zombie George Washington. Add in a helping of crazy zombie Civil War dudes, zombie Jimi Hendrix, zombie Teddy Roosevelt and you get the idea.

Volume three clocks in at over 300 pages and contains the work of over 45 writers, artists, letterers, and is *just* about complete and ready to go.
The logistics are all locked in except for one important part and that's what brings us to Kickstarter. We're here  to ask you ladies and gents once again for a little help getting this third volume off to the  printer. If funding is successful we intend to use the money exclusively for the offset print run of FUBAR: American History Z. 
Any amount over the initial goal will go to print more books!
REWARDS
To get to our goal we've got a bunch of great custom rewards and sketches. Each backer that selects any or all volumes for a reward gets their choice of ANY custom World War II or historical American zombie head sketch right on the first page of each book!
INTERNATIONAL REWARDS
We've added international shipping rates to each reward to compensate for International backers. We've kept them as low as we can to make sure you guys and girls can get the best value for your pledge. Any questions, just shoot us a message.
THANK YOU!!
Your support of Indie comics in general and FUBAR in particular makes it possible for these project to exist and thrive. I know I can speak for all the creators involved when I say thanks you for your time and thank you for your support.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
After this project is funded we begin the work of getting FUBAR: American History Z out to the public at large. We are at the end of the day a young press competing with publishers that have been putting out books for over half a century with characters that have become part of Americana. Distribution is always the end game once the long creative process is over and in many ways it is the most challenging part.


This is our second Kickstarter campaign to publish a volume of FUBAR. the first campaign saw FUBAR: Empire of the Rising dead off to the printer. With help from many retailers, contributors and backers we got that volume on THE NEW YORK TIMES BEST SELLER list. The first Kickstarter funded comic thus far to land on the list. OXYMORON is an OVERSIZED HARDCOVER graphic novel collection of stories about a supervillain psychopath obsessed with contradiction.  Spinning out of the pages of the comic book series THE RED TEN by Tyler James & Cesar Feliciano, the man with the killer smile finally takes center stage.  This stunning hardcover collection features stories by up-and-coming writers and artists, including Jason Ciaramella (The Cape, Godzilla), Joe Mulvey (Scam), Mark Poulton (Avengelyne, Savage Hawkman), and more, and is edited by ComixTribe publisher Tyler James.
*** NEW SUPER-STRETCH GOAL UNLOCKED AT $25,000 ***
Oxymoron Hardcover mock-up (Cover art by Jonathan Rector, colors by Ty Tyner)
With the help of Kickstarter and backers like you, I want to take the nearly complete graphic novel and produce a hideously beautiful 112-page, full color, hardcover collection.
BECAUSE OF THE SUCCESS OF THIS CAMPAIGN, VARIANT COVERS HAVE BEEN UNLOCKED!
THE BONUS UNLOCKS!
Check the FAQ below for more details on getting a variant!
If you'd like to keep up with this project, I'll be posting updates here:
Twitter: @tylerjamescomics  Hashtag: #Oxymoron2012
Website: www.ComixTribe.com
Want a Sample?
Download the OXYMORON in "Living Dead" by Mark Bertolini and Carl Yonder right now, absolutely free!
ABOUT THE BOOK
OXYMORON Volume 1 collects ten stories by some of the best up-and-coming writers and artists in comics today.  Included in this volume:
Passive Aggressive
Four...yes, four little piggies run the Swanstown criminal underground.  That is, until Oxymoron comes to town...
"Passive Aggressive" written by Jason Ciaramella (The Cape, Godzilla), Art by Joe Mulvey (SCAM)  
Selfless Man
When the media showers praise on a fire-fighter for bravely rescuing a child from a burning building, the Oxymoron sets out to prove there's no such thing as a "selfless man."
"Selfless Man" written by John Lees (The Standard), Art by Tyler James (The Red Ten, Tears of the Dragon, Over)
Double Standard
The Oxymoron goes on a killing spree, targeting those who are infringing on his turf of having it both ways: an actor who's appeared in multiple comic movie universes; a rapper turned Oscar winner, and a hypocritical family values politician. And that's just his opening act...
Story by Steven Forbes (Runners, Bullet Time), Art by Dave Myers (Warriors of Dharuk)
Alone in a Crowd
An Oxymoron-inspired anarchist uprising threatens to bring chaos upon Swanstown.  The only person more dedicated to crushing the so-called Oxy-Chaos army than the Chief-of-Police...is the Oxymoron himself!
"Alone in a Crowd" written by Ryan K Lindsay (Ghost Town, Heist), and Daniel J Logan (Back in the Day, Exo-1)
Nearly Perfect
The Oxymoron kidnaps the top finalists of the Miss Swanstown pageant and has his own ideas on how to determine the winner! Who will it be? The stunning surgery addict? The backstabbing best friend? Who knows? It's up to Red and the Crimson Kid to track down the Contradictory Con before the pretty girls turn up... awfully prettier!
"Nearly Perfect" written by Yannick Morin (Points of Impact), Art by Alex Cormack (Chikara)
Working  Holiday 
The Oxy-Grinch aims to ruin the holidays for the children of Swanstown Orphanage. But, Oxy may have met his match in the form an orphan who is a veritable minor disaster.
"Working Holiday" written by Mark Poulton (Savage Hawkman, Avengelyne), Art by Jules Rivera (Valkyrie Squadron, Marsh Rocket)
Act Naturally
The Royal Shakespeare Touring Company's debut of Romeo and Juliet at Swanstown's prestigious Woodmire Hall is taken under the Oxymoron's psychotic direction - that is, until Red shows up. But, is she just playing her part in Oxy's latest tragic comedy? 
"Act Naturally" written by Rich Douek (Gutter Magic), Art by Rafer Roberts (Plastic Farm)
Living Dead
A horde of the living dead threaten to take overtake the city...but there's only room for one Oxymoron in Swanstown. 
"Living Dead" written by Mark Bertolini (Fubar II, Breakneck, Ghostlines), Art by Carl Yonder (Fubar II, Ghostlines)
AVAILABLE AS A FREE DOWNLOAD NOW!
Quiet Riot 
The Oxymoron holds all of Swanstown hostage in terrifying silence, as one cop struggles to stop the madman before her city burns to the ground.
"Quiet Riot" written by Paul Allor (Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Clockwork), Art by Aaron Houston (Clockwork)

Welcome to the official Kickstarter page for the original graphic novel PAWN SHOP by Joey Esposito and Sean Von Gorman with letters by Adam Pruett, a story about four New Yorkers whose lives unknowingly intersect through -- yep, you guessed it -- a Manhattan pawn shop. 
You'll find the first 6 pages of our story below (or, if you prefer, at this link) -- please give it a read and then "like", tweet, share, and talk the heck out of this page. We need everyone's help!
Update 8/7: We're ECSTATIC to announce that we've reached our $7000 goal! As per our incentive for accomplishing that goal before 8/10, all backers at the $10 reward level or higher will receive a digital download of the Pawn Shop Script Book. We want to offer our sincerest thanks for everyone that's pledged and promoted so far. It means the world to us. Let's keep it going!
NEW STRETCH REWARDS! As we reach new milestones, brand new rewards will be unlocked for our backers:
$8,000 - PAWN SHOP VIDEO JOURNALS (backers only). -- UNLOCKED!!
$10,000 - Every $25+ backer will receive a Kickstarter Exclusive Pawn Shop art print by FOOTPRINTS artist Jonathan Moore. -- UNLOCKED!!
$13,000 - Every $50+ backer will receive a Kickstarter Exclusive Pawn Shop Photography Book, featuring a specially commissioned photography series of real New York City pawn shops. -- LOCKED
$15,000 - Every $50+ backer that's receiving the CD Mixtape will receive it with Pawn Shop Mix Tape album cover by 2000AD artist Simon Fraser. -- LOCKED
$16,000 - Every $25+ backer will get a free preview ashcan before the book's release, complete with exclusive sketches and designs not available anyplace else. -- LOCKED
$18,000 -- We’ll add a whole additional chapter to the book. -- LOCKED
$20,000 -- We'll upgrade Pawn Shop to a larger format and a sharp-lookin' hardcover. -- LOCKED
Update 8/18: We're offering some brand new rewards for you procrastinators that haven't pledged yet! Check them out!
THE STORY.
Anyone that lives in a major city knows that there are millions upon millions of people rubbing elbows with one another each and every day. But what they often fail to remember is that we're all part of the same ecosystem; everyone is inevitably connected to each other, affecting one another's lives whether they know it or not. 
And that's what Pawn Shop is about. Each chapter follows a different character in a stand-alone tale that ultimately intertwines with the others, painting a larger portrait of their lives together in New York City. 
The book is being rendered in a gorgeous mixture of watercolor and digital elements that, hopefully, gives it a unique feel that works to capture the magic diversity of New York City itself.
WHO WE ARE.
Joey Esposito is a writer who last year Kickstarted his comic Footprints (with artist Jonathan Moore). He's also the writer of Zenescope's Grimm Fairy Tales: Bad Girls and has had his work featured as a back-up story in Image Comics' Grim Leaper. You also may know him as the Comics Editor for IGN.com. He moved away from New York and has regretted it every day since. Pawn Shop is his attempt to make amends. You can find him on Twitter or visit his website.
Sean Von Gorman is an illustrator and escape artist born and raised in Brooklyn, NY. Sean is co-creator of the forthcoming graphic novel series Secret Adventures of Houdini as well as the creator of Sock It To Me Comics, both with Alterna Comics. During the self-publishing run of Secret Adventures of Houdini Sean handcuffed himself outside Forbidden Planet NYC until every book was sold. He recently preformed his escape act for Amanda Palmer’s AFP Kickstarter Countdown Party at the bidding of her husband Neil Gaiman. He's such a devoted artist that he worked on some Pawn Shop pages while admitted to the ER (see below). You can find him on Twitter or visit his website.
Adam Pruett has lettered comics for Arcana, Image, Markosia, Pop Goes the Icon, Black Jack Press, and various other publishers. He also makes his own comics sometimes. You can find him on Twitter.
WHY KICKSTARTER?
Pawn Shop is a slice-of-life story. That means it's "soft." There're no monsters, no violence, no tights, and certainly no flights. There's no "genre" hook. But what there is is something even better: a story everyone can relate to. 
Pawn Shop was born out of the realization that there is nothing more fascinating, dramatic, intriguing, joyful, depressing, and outright absurd than everyday human existence. We're turning to Kickstarter out of a need to explore these ideas. We know that there's an audience out there for these kind of comics, and we think that's the beauty of Kickstarter -- people will support what they really want. 
We're looking to you to make this book happen, and we hope you'll join us for the ride. 
THE REWARDS.
We're offering a boatload of great stuff from the usual items -- digital downloads, a copy of the book, art prints, original artwork, etc. -- to the more... well, out there. We're offering things like Sean coming to your location (continental US only) to perform a straight jacket escape (yes, he really does that), CD mix tapes to supplement your reading experience, illustrated/performed poems, and we're even putting the very dedication of this book up for grabs. 
There's also opportunities to co-write a bonus story for the book and become characters in the story itself. As we reach certain goals, we'll unlock even more rewards. 
WHERE IS YOUR $$ GOING?
We're aiming for a print run of 1000 graphic novels that we will publish and distribute ourselves in comic shops and digitally. Neither creator is taking any sort of payment on this project, so all of your money will be going towards making comics 100%. 
If we happen to exceed our goal, the excess funds will go toward printing more copies of the book, or, if the excess is significant, upgrading the book to a larger format, making it a hardcover, etc. Beyond that, excess funds will go to assuring that we're out at any and every convention possible to promote Pawn Shop. 
IS SEAN FOR REAL ABOUT THE ESCAPE ACT?
Yes.

campaign.story:
Every person who contributes $11 or more will receive every PDF issue of Quandary as they are released. (I can't edit the reward text on the right, so I figured I'd tell you this way.)
What is QUANDARY? 
Quandary is a digital comic of a story that takes place twenty years in the future. In this future, we all live in a 'police state'. We've been at war in the Middle East, where hundreds die every day, for the last thirty years. Protesters in the 'We the People' movement are regarded as terrorists, hunted down and executed for challenging the system. Basic rights are being stripped away, one mandate at a time. Then, one event—an accidental death―inadvertently sets in motion the wheels of a revolution, and tyranny begins eroding from within.
If Quandary were a mixed drink, the recipe would be:  2 parts George Orwell's 1984, 2 parts 'life as we know it', and 1 part Occupy movement.
Here's a sneak peek of one of the pages!  (click image to enlarge)
Noah and Cadence: characters revealed in issue #2. (click image to enlarge)
Another sneak peek at issue #1

Why raise funds for a digital comic?
Aside from printing costs, there is no financial difference between a digitally published comic and a printed one. ISBN numbers still have to be registered, creative contributors still need to be compensated, files continue to require hosting, and the importance of promotional materials remains. If successful, this Kickstarter will offset the cost of all of these items, ensuring that publish-ready issues meet a monthly deadline. 
Provisionally, we are saying that Quandary will appear over nine issues that are around twelve pages each. The primary Artist, Ken Frederick, will be responsible for illustrating the bulk of these issues. However, three issues will feature the work of guest artists. A few more guest artists will contribute to creating promotional art. This project is a labor of love for Ken and me, so we both will be working, unpaid.

Will this digital comic also be printed? 
Yes! Issue #1 will be printed inside the Kickstarter Exclusive ‘Making of Quandary’ magazine, along with information and images from the development process, concept art, and more!
Furthermore, the series, when complete (est. 8/2013), will be printed in full and bound into both a softcover and hardcover edition available for purchase on Amazon, as well as at various comic shops in the NYC/NJ area.

So, who's the creative team? 
Writer:  Janine Frederick (Hudson Valley Zombie Apocalypse Graphic Novel, Awaken, Aleksander Christov) Janine's Web site
Main Artist:  Ken Frederick (Hudson Valley Zombie Apocalypse Graphic Novel, The Forgotten Dead, Aleksander Christov) Ken's Web site
Guest Artist:  Gabriel Bautista (Illustrator: Elephantmen, Jesus Christ: In the Name of the Gun; Colorist: All-Star Western, Will Eisner's The Spirit) Gabriel's Web site
Guest Artist:  Silvio dB (Eagle Awards New Talent Competition Winner; Illustrator: The Time of Reflection, Meridien City) Silvio's Web site
Guest Promo Artist:  Tom Feister (Illustrator: GI Joe, DC Comics, Dark Horse Comics, Lucasfilm, Marvel Comics ) Tom's Deviant Art page
Guest Promo Artist:  Richard P. Clark (Illustrator: HBO, Wall Street Journal, Playboy, DC Comics, Dark Horse, Blind Ferret Entertainment, and more.) www.zippystudio.com
Guest Promo Artist:  Ian Dorian (Phoenix #0, Marvel & DC sketch cards, Awaken) Ian's Web site
Guest Promo Artist:  Igor Glushkin (Illustrator:  Lady Gunns, Isolation) Igor's Web site

That's pretty cool!  Tell me about the REWARDS.
Sure thing! As you can see on the right, there are several different reward levels to accommodate all different pledge opportunities. Each reward description is specific in what it includes, so please don't worry about having to remember what the the lower-end rewards were in order to get an accurate picture of what your reward will be. No 'researching'. This is Kickstarter . . . not a term paper.
We've been able to collaborate with some amazing people over the past two years. They have shown their support of our Quandary project by offering their time, talents, and handiwork―all to help us meet our fundraising goal. Now a lucky few contributors will be able to have a one-of-a-kind oil painting by Richard P. Clark, a few budding comics writers will get to have a 22-page script reviewed by an IDW-published comics professional, and a few others will have the opportunity to be heard by an audience of about a hundred thousand with my friends, Ming and Mike, on a SmodCo podcast! If those rewards don't suit you, we have some classic reward items—sketches, prints, and a 'making of' magazine, to name a few—to offer as well.
UPDATE:  Celebrate Independence!  Every contributor gets a free PDF of the independently produced one-shot zombie apocalypse-themed comic called THE FORGOTTEN DEAD.  This comic was penciled and inked by Ken Frederick, main artist on Quandary, and written by Chris Murphy, friend & supporter!THE FORGOTTEN DEAD tells the story of the Museum of Modern Art's curators' last ditch efforts to save some of the world's most treasured and all-but-forgotten masterpieces before the museums perimeters were breached by the undead.
UPDATE (6/29):  New T-shirt reward launched at the $35 level! 
($35 reward includes T-shirt, 11 x 17 Kickstarter exclusive print, 'Making of Quandary' magazine, PDF of issue #1, and a mention of thanks on the Quandary web site.)
Please note: If your reward needs to be sent outside the US, please add $5 to to your contribution to help with the added shipping cost. Thank you so much!

What happens if this Kickstarter raises more than $2,500?
The original Kickstarter goal of $2,500 is sufficient only to offset the total cost of putting this project together. By no means will it cover the project in its entirety. If we happen to exceed our Kickstarter goal, then the funds in excess of $2,500 will be put toward the remaining costs of developing this project. 
If the Kickstarter goal is greatlyexceeded and the current estimated project costs are more than paid by what's raised here, then the available funds will be put toward our wish list items: hiring a dedicated colorist, having a consulting editor, enlisting additional guest artists, producing the aforementioned hardcover and softcover editions of the completed series, and giving the creative team a bonus.
Thank you for your consideration, support, and generosity!
